title: What is the signifigance of SSO POP device credentials with user name I do not recognize?
content:
I am a residential consumer electronics integrator with pretty extensive recent experience specifying and deploying residential networks to support a variety of CE equipment. I have been browsing forum to improve my knowledge of issues related to use of Thunderbird with Comcast email server. This was prompted by three things: 1) I experience intermittent inability to send or receive Comcast mail through Thunderbird; imap.comcast.net port 993 2) Fielding many customer complaints relating to inability to use other (non Thunderbird) 3rd party mail clients, has led to several calls to Comcast tech support and recently the cheerful "Welcome to Xfinity" auto-bot outgoing message reel has included a long, politely-ominous warning that Comcast will soon be ending support of certain (unspecified) legacy email clients. 3) When digging about in the control panel of my venerable Windows 10 HP laptop, I opened the Credentials manager and under Windows accounts I found a credential that is unfamiliar and totally meaningless to me. I also found a credential related to SONY XBox which I deleted as I do not own a Sony XBox. As this laptop travels with me to various jobs and is often used on a variety of networks and sometimes used (with permissions) by remote tech support folks I wonder if this unknown credential is a result of that. Anyone on this forum willing to have a look? Also I would like to get any relevant information about bullet point 2 as it relates to Thunderbird. How are relations with Thunderbird and Comcast mail services?

Thanks Doug
creator: seeheargear

title: Fail sending email

However when sending an email the program asks for the password to be entered again. Incoming emails are not affected. Where do I go to setup the outgoing server details.

title: The "SUBJECT" column in message pane is not a display choice.
content: I too had this problem which is answered at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1372085. Although it provides a work around to the problem it does not solve the problem. The SUBJECT column is an essential part of the index and if it is not showing there should be a way to select it as one of the columns. There is even the scenario where the problem I had applied to all the folders and there was no folder to copy/paste to those where the subject was not showing!

Any ideas?

There was an error

Unexpected GET request on /saml2/authn_response

If you are seeing this page after clicking a link sent to you via email, make sure you only click the confirmation link once, and that you open the validation link in the same client you're logging in from.

Try logging in again from your Matrix client and if the problem persists please contact the server's administrator.

title: Issues with syncing calendars via lightning

When I open the calendar on google all the appointments from both are there, but it doesn't sync on Thunderbird until I restart the program. I'm out of ideas at this point.

title: Thunderbird browser not supported by Microsoft = no more TB email?
content:
For the last few days I am unable to access my work email (Microsoft exchange server) from Thunderbird. I'm running 102.7.2 (32-bit) on Windows 10. I'm logged in to my work Microsoft account. An attempt to get email in TB brings up a password dialogue, https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/login which I complete. This is followed by 2-factor authentification, which I complete, to see the following error message:

"You can't get there from here This application contains sensitive information and can only be accessed from: 

   Devices or client applications that meet <employer> management compliance policy.

The current browser is not supported, please use Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer, Chrome or Firefox 91+ to access this application."

My IT services people say this may be an issue with Thunderbird, although I think the error message says they have removed authorisation for TB. The latest TB update and Windows 10 update happened shortly before this problem started. I've rolled back the Windows update, no joy. I can't see a way to undo the TB update and am reluctant to reinstall from scratch as my 3 other email addresses are working fine.

Could this be a TB issue? Is there anything I can do to fix it?
creator: RichardB1

title: Issue using TB in two Windows 10 accounts at the same time.
content:
I had TB open in a Windows Std User. Then I logged in to an administrator account while leaving the Std user logged in. As the admin user, I started TB and accessed the same accounts as the Std user. I then exited TB and switched back to the Std user.

I then noticed that the TB window was not visible but the app was still in the Task Bar so I knew it was still running. When I clicked on the Task Bar icon, the windows still did not become visible. It appeared in the preview that the TB window dimensions were very small, i.e., you could only see a small portion of the upper left corner of the whole window, and the location was off screen (I have two monitors). So I maximized the window then dragged the title bar to make is a normalized size window.

So the question is: What is the expected behavior when Thunderbird is running in two different Windows accounts at the same time? I'd expect it to behave normally and not become confused like this. Is there something I should be aware of in this case?
creator: johned0420

title: Calendar: Show notifications for upcoming events
content:
I'm trying to understand the difference between "Reminder Defaults" and "Notifications" in the Calendar Settings page.

My assumption is that "Default time a reminder is set before an event" means that, when creating a new event, a reminder will be set for whatever time the default is set for (e.g, 15 minutes, 1 hour, etc.)

On the other hand, "Show notifications for upcoming events" will show a notification for EVERY event, whether or not a reminder was set.

Are my assumptions correct or are there other behaviors that these settings control?

Thanks!
creator: rorywohl

title: Reply email using gmail not using original account

I never had this issue in mailbird and it just worked fine ? 

Any ideas?

title: Thunderbird email - Junk Mail
content:
Windows 10 / Thunderbird 102.7.2 :

Have been trying to make sense of the "teach Thunderbird" to automatically identify Junk communications and delete them. Specifically, what I would like is for Spam messages to automatically be sent to Junk -- where I can do a quick review and then empty Junk.

Particularly: I have repeatedly marked certain incoming emails as Junk, and most of them disappear from InBox and show up in Junk; however, when similar messages show up in Spam, I have to "re-mark" them every time rather than the program recognizing them and sending them on their trashy way.

Any info about what I'm now knowing about all of this?

Thank you / appreciated.
